fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15299].
  {panel}

Many peoples get themselves into "bizarre" problems, when they restore a xml backup of the production into a test JIRA instance and start to receive "weird" emails.

Users create support request in SAC and blame JIRA for:
- notification emails on "ghost"/not existing  issues,
- duplicated notification and subscription messages,
- outdated content of the subscription messages.

Quotes from SAC cases:
{quote}
For instance, if I send an email to help@mycomp.com it will create a ticket in jira... sometimes it will create it as TS-5769 (The proper ticket number), and other times it would be TS-5716 (an outdated ticket). The email that we receive as a notification stating the ticket was created seems fine, it has all the information that was submitted (except for the ticket number), but when you click on the link (ticket number), it will be an outdated ticket.... It's very strange! 
{quote}
and one more about subscription:
{quote}
One of our users had a subscription set up that she had deleted, along with the filter used for the subscription, so both of these no longer exist. The subscription is still being sent on the schedule she had set up, and it's always the same old data. I posted a message on the forum but their ideas have not worked. Can anyone help me with this? I don't think there has been any info in the log on it, but I'll attach those just in case, along with one of the email subscriptions that was just sent last night.
{quote}

Perhaps JIRA should:
- on the Import page give option to manually enable the services after the restore, but by default disable them,
- after restore list all disabled services,
- display warning in the UI that services are disabled,
- allow to manually enable the single services from the UI.
fields.summary: Disable mail services after xml restore of JIRA backup to another instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15297].
  {panel}

Each Workflow step can have Conditions, Validators, or Post-Functions associated with them.  Having these features associated with the Clone and Edit operations would allow easier manipulation and greater control of issues:

- Associate a permission with the Clone permission to restrict who can clone on a per-project (or global) basis
- Add a Clone post-function to delete certain fields that would be undesirable
- Check the value of a certain field is populated after an edit (or process the field contents)

In my particular use case, I wish to see a series of custom fields be cleared out when an Issue is cloned from another.
fields.summary: Add Conditions, Validators, Post Functions  to the Clone, Edit operations
Add the ability to copy a custom field context
Delete Attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15260].
  {panel}

Like a filter subscription, Is there any way by that we can subscribe for

1) Dashboard
2) Pie Chart
3) Excel formatted Jira issue report
4) Two dimension filter static

The requirement is that user want a report that should run periodically 8 hrs, and the report should show,
1) Total issue updated by team in the last 8 hrs with issue no.
2) Total issue updated by individual team member in the last 8 hrs with issue number.

To do this, the user thought of configuring a pie chart and 2D filter and subscribe this dashboard for mail Notification, but JIRA does not support this functionality at the moment.
fields.summary: Add ability to subscribe dashboards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15259].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA doesn't allow to move a sub-task from one project to another.

If you try to perform this operation you get the following error:

bq. Cannot link Parent issue from a different project

This task can be performed in a few separate steps.
# Convert sub-task to issue.
# Move newly created issue to other project
# Convert it to sub-task in destination project
fields.summary: It should be possible to move sub-task from parent issue in one project to a parent issue in another project
Search Issues updated by user in a certain time frame
add JRE requirment for the JIRA client side in order to use the screenshot applet
Watched Issues Page: When I UNWATCH issue not on first page, it moves me to first page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15219].
  {panel}

When a user selects a Project (say ProjX) and Issue Type (eg Task) in the "Create New Issue" wizard, then JIRA remembers these two values in the user's session as the 
last selected Project and last selected Issue Type.
Next time the user creates a new issue, then these two values are used to initialise the selected values.
If the user browses a project or issue, then the selected Project is changed accordingly (eg to ProjY), while the "selected issue type" remains the same.
When the user now clicks "create new issue", JIRA initialises the Project to ProjY, and the issue type to Task, unless Task is not a valid issue type for that project.
In this case, it just defaults to the first issue type in the list.
This is inconsistent with other behaviour, and it would be better if the "default issue type" for the Project was used in this case.
fields.summary: When JIRA sets intitial values for "Create New Issue", and the "last selected issue type" is not valid for the "selected Project", it should use the default Issue type for the Project.
Show issue type legend in reports
Add TemplateIssue objects to the VelocityContext of text subscription e-mails
User preference for default tab opened by issue viewer
Jelly Tag  TransitionWorkflow  should have the  attribute for updated date
Make bulk move operation more user-friendly during field update stage
No translation possibility offered for sub-tasks, only for standard tasks in the issue type section of the admini ui
Request for custom field type  - IP Address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15129].
{panel}
*The problem*
 - Nonquoted comment handler strips quotes, not signatures
 - Regex handler strips signatures, but not quotes
 - 

*Solution*
- The new handler should be able to strip both; quoted e-mails as well as signatures.

-  filter out all the other files which is gifs & jpg  from email

*Related issues*
This issue was created based on JRA-15072.
fields.summary: Handler that strips both quoted e-mails as well as signatures.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15128].
  {panel}

This issue just jammed me up and I think it's a terrible UI design to include the "Screens" operation under "View Field Configuration" when that operation applies to ALL field configurations across all schemes without any warning.  We're using the Enterprise Edition and setup a number of unique projects and configurations and I was shocked to find out that in the process of removing screens from one of my configurations that I had copied that I disabled functionality in my other projects.

In my example I had the following setup:
------------
Field Configuration Schemes:
	- Issue Reporting 1 --> Project 1
	- Issue Reporting 2 --> Project 2

Field Configuration:
	- Issue Screen 1
	- Issue Screen 2

Screens:
	- Enter Issue 1 --> Project 1
	- Assign Issue 1 --> Project 1
	- Enter Issue 2 --> Project 2
	- Assign Issue 2 --> Project 2

Field Configuration Issue Screen 1:
	- Assignee -->
		- Enter Issue 1
		- Assign Issue 1
		- Enter Issue 2
		- Assign Issue 2

	- Description -->
		- Enter Issue 1
		- Assign Issue 1
		- Enter Issue 2
		- Assign Issue 2

Field Configuration Issue Screen 2 (copied of Issue Screen 1):
	- Assignee -->
		- Enter Issue 1
		- Assign Issue 1
		- Enter Issue 2
		- Assign Issue 2

	- Description -->
		- Enter Issue 1
		- Assign Issue 1
		- Enter Issue 2
		- Assign Issue 2		
------------

I then went and removed the Assignee and Description from the "Enter Issue 1" and "Assign Issue 1" screens in "Field Configuration Issue Screen 2" and ended up losing all those fields in "Project 1" which uses "Enter Issue 1" and "Assign Issue 1".  Had I seen some sort of warning in bold-red font that I was about to change ALL of my projects, or better yet -- if this action was not even permitted here, I would have never done this.  Putting a note in the documentation is not good enough, you need to have a warning in the UI because it's definitely not clear that you're changing all your projects..... why bother to have separate configuration areas if it's going to affect everything?  The only thing you see on the "Associate field XXXXXX to screens" page is:   "Associate the field XXXXXX to the appropriate screens. You must associate a field to a screen before it will be displayed. New fields will be added to the end of a tab."  No warning at all....

To me it sounds like this UI works good for the non- Enterprise Edition of Jira, which does not allow multiple Field Configurations, and it was just left as is for the Enterprise Edition where it's definitely not sufficient.
fields.summary: View Field Configuration UI should not include the "Screens" operation without a disclaimer since it affects ALL projects/configurations.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15110].
  {panel}

Add an email notification service that sent email notification messages to System admins on critical events in the application.

For a small JIRA installations or hosted instances where there are not dedicated webserver administrators and nobody monitor the application, often problems need to become critical before are investigated.

Similary to [JRA-15109|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15109] there are many advantages of such as feature. 
{quote}
Perhaps the most significant are:

   1. Monitor in a better way "helth" of the application - some of the user don't even know what is a web app server (Tomcat/Reisen) and where to look for the log files.
   2. Diagnose problems in their early stage - e.g. mailhandler issues/misconfiguration are not visible without access to the log file.
   3. Users would attempt to address common and obvious issues listed in the log file if the would have a "convenient" access to the logs.
   4. In overall it should impact number of support request logged in SAC.

Many web based application already include similar features.
{quote}

A simple solution only send the logs or warnings, where complex implementations include ability to set up triggers and monitors on various custom defined events.
fields.summary: Email notification service that notifies System admins on critical events in the application.
Customfield with context (issue type) does not appear on the quick subtask creation form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15088].
  {panel}

Commonly our IT department will create a mailbox on the wrong server causing the following exception to the log:

[quote]
2008-06-11 11:24:25,244 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ERROR [service.services.mail.MailFetcherService] Messaging Exception in service 'com.atlassian.jira.service.services.imap.ImapService' when getting mail: A2 NO There is no replica for that mailbox on this server.;
  nested exception is:
        com.sun.mail.iap.CommandFailedException: A2 NO There is no replica for that mailbox on this server.
javax.mail.MessagingException: A2 NO There is no replica for that mailbox on this server.;
  nested exception is:
        com.sun.mail.iap.CommandFailedException: A2 NO There is no replica for that mailbox on this server.
        at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPFolder.doCommand(IMAPFolder.java:2125)
        at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPFolder.exists(IMAPFolder.java:406)
        at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPFolder.checkExists(IMAPFolder.java:280)
        at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPFolder.open(IMAPFolder.java:779)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:160)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:61)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
[quote]

Two things should be changed to better help identify problems like these:

a.) The account with the problem should be printed to the log so an admin can actually figure out problem accounts.
b.) The admin interface should turn accounts red (and preferably show error message) for problem accounts.

a is much easier and much higher priority than b.
fields.summary: Notify which mail accounts have errors
Allow work logs to be moved between tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15069].
  {panel}

Issues created/commented on via email often have too much whitespace - double spaces between lines, etc. This makes the resulting descriptions/comments hard to read.

One solution would be to allow the user to specify two new parameters on the 'createissue' and 'createorcommentissue' handlers. These would be as follows:
regex = regular expression to match with in replaceall
regexreplace = what to replace every found instance of 'regex'

I have made these changes to my version of 3.12.3 code and attached the modified files. Three files were modified:

com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateOrCommentHandler
com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateIssueHandler
com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.FullCommentHandler
fields.summary: Apply regular expression to email'd issue create/issue comments (remove spaces)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15060].
  {panel}

We have two current support requests in which customers would like to be able to create issues from emails that have a blank subject. They state that they cannot guarantee that users will always enter a subject in their email, but that they still really want issues to be created for these emails.

Our current CreateIssueHandler rejects emails that do not have a subject.

So this improvement request is that we consider providing a configuration option so that administrators can decide whether they want emails with no subject to be:
- rejected, or
- accepted with some default subject, with maybe the ability to specify what the default subject would be.
fields.summary: Allow issues to be created from emails that do not have a subject

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15059].
  {panel}

Currently the JiraLuceneFieldCache has a cache that does nothing (this is one purpose).  The cache used to be in place (but I am sure it was broken back then) bu it was disabled.

It used by Both Lucene and 1/2DimensionalermHitCollectors  and anything else that uses the StatisticAccessorBean.searchCountMap().

This creates an index the size of the index that sticks around for the request and does not cache it.
There was an old cache in place but Scott removed this around 3.8.

Options:
# Fix cache - add caching to getMatches() but not for getCustom().
# Switch everything that use this to use a DocHitCollector (a LOT more memory efficient but may need to do performance hits).
fields.summary: One/TwoDimensionalTermHitCollectors use StatsJiraLuceneFieldCache with no cacheing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15055].
  {panel}

On the SL JIRA someone suggested color coding for comments. https://jira.secondlife.com/browse/WEB-688

This shouldn't be too hard to do, just a few extra css classes for comments and changes.

The attached greasemonkey script is for Firefox 3 only due to using semitransparent colors (rgba). It color codes comments based on Reporter, Assignee and by last name (i wrote it for the SL Jira).

EDIT: The attached versions are old, get the latest version here: http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/27838
fields.summary: Color coding of comments based on group, reporter and assignee
SSO credentials not used in IssueViewURLHandler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15045].
  {panel}

When a plugin adds a custom-field, or service, or some other configurable element to JIRA -- these elements are seen in the administration panel and can be deleted. Later when upgrading it might be that this particular plugin is not needed anymore, and thus it is discarded.

One such example is the Perforce plugin and the new Beta Fisheye-Perforce, the old Perforce plugin is not really needed anymore and the two plugins are not compatible so the old one is not included in the installed war.

Thing is -- the custom fields, and services of that plugin are still in the database -- there is currently no way other than to dig into the database directy to remove these fields and services. And when running JIRA it is causing (non critical) errors that get logged.

Example of logged errors for custom fields:
{code}
ERROR [jira.issue.managers.DefaultCustomFieldManager] Could not find any custom field value
with key 'com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.perforce:hiddenjobswitch'.
ERROR [jira.issue.managers.DefaultCustomFieldManager] Could not find any custom field value
with key 'com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.perforce:jobcheckbox'.
{code}

Example for services:
{code}
ERROR [atlassian.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore] Unable to create a service config for
service with name: Perforce Changes Indexing Service
com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceException: Could not find
class: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.perforce.changelists.ChangesIndexService
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceFactory.getService(ServiceFactory.java:36)
        . . .
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.perforce.changelists.ChangesIndexService
        at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.loadClass(WebappClassLoader.java:1363)
        . . .
{code}

Would it not be better to have these "defunct" elements seen as "broken" in the administration panel and safely removed from there, without tampering with the database?
fields.summary: Make existing components such as services that are supplied by plugins visible in administration section even if the plugin is missing
New notification type: Subtask changed/closed
Wiki Renderer creates HTML that causes MS Word 2007 / Outlook 2007 to crash
RendererPreviewAjaxUtil should be aware of project & issue type context when creating a new issue
Improve the Issue Links column in Issue Naviagtor
Add a option to make the created and updated fields to show time and not just date in Issue Navigator
Internet Explorer fails to open time report excel sheet if accessed through bookmarked or written directly in URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15010].
  {panel}

Bulk move of a large number of issues from one project to the other.  Expected the order of creation of issue to match the original, it appears to be random.  For instance, if I bulk move X-1, X-2, X-3,  I would expect something like:
* X-1 -> Y-101
* X-2 -> Y-102
* X-3 -> Y-103
Either make the order predictable or option to specify the order. For instance, the order displayed in the UI.  In our case, the order in the UI was ascending by issue number, so expected result to be the same.
fields.summary: Bulk move - ordering
add handler-parameters to Create-Issue Handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15002].
  {panel}

There are two new Workflow Transition Conditions that we'd like:
- User Is In Field
- User Is In Multi-User Field

The two are quite similar, what we really want is the latter.

The condition here is that the user who attempts to execute that transition should be referenced in a named field on the issue.

So assume a support workflow with an approval step. The support person says "in order to give privileges to System X, one of managers A, B, or C must approve the request." The support person puts A, B, and C into the "Approvers" field, and only A, B, or C can approve the request to go forward.

This is logically EXTREMELY similar to "User Is In Group Custom Field", except that it relies on individual users rather than JIRA groups.
fields.summary: "User is in Multi-User Field" Condition on Workflow Transition

fields.description:
It would be useful for me (and our users) if closed issues could be displayed slightly differently in the issue navigator, and on the issue details page.
Ie could display them with a light grey background, and different font colors or something, so it's really quick to spot the issue is already closed.

Sometimes I'll have someone search for an issue and not see immediatley that it's been closed.
fields.summary: Display Closed issues differently in lists and in detail view
Notification Scheme - Add additional configuration point of Status
Link change group to the comment on the comment tab on view issue
Add option to create link back to the parent issue when converting sub-task to an issue
Search suggestions for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14974].
  {panel}

With a single email POP server we can make use of *catchmail* to route such mail to a nominated project.  Thats great, now do it for 90 project, 1000 project?

Manually configuring numerous services entries to enable email delivery to the projects is a royal pain.

To fix this, Ive modified the CreateIssueHandler (and I think AbstractMessageHandler, submitted under [JRA-14973]) to enable a single Handler to automatically lookup the projectkey from the email address, so just ONE entry is required for *n* projects.

The scenario supporting how this works is setting up a Virtual Mailbox, so all mail to a given domain 'whatever@jira.server.net' ends up in a single mailbox.  After this, the to: address just has the domain stripped off and upper cased to check for a project.

Please take this into codebase so I don't have to keep building it!
fields.summary: CreateIssueHandler patch (autoAssign emails to Projects based on email TO: address
Wiki-rendered diffs for email notifications or change history when a wiki-text-rendered field is edited.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14967].
  {panel}

Feel free to move this to a 3rd party bug or Improvement if it's not a bug as I'm not 100% positive.

In our WSDL, it describes RemoteIssue like this:

{code}
      <complexType name="RemoteIssue">
	<complexContent>
	<extension base="tns1:AbstractRemoteEntity">
             <sequence>
             <element name="affectsVersions" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_tns1_RemoteVersion"/>
             <element name="assignee" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
             <element name="attachmentNames" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_xsd_string"/>
             <element name="components" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_tns1_RemoteComponent"/>
             <element name="created" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"/>
             <element name="customFieldValues" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_tns1_RemoteCustomFieldValue"/>
             <element name="description" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
             <element name="duedate" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"/>
             <element name="environment" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
             <element name="fixVersions" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_tns1_RemoteVersion"/>
             <element name="key" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
.
.
.
{code}

When the actual response is returned, it inserts *ID* (derived from AbstractRemoteEntity) after *fixVersions* which differs from the WSDL sequence.

{code}
.
.
.
      <description xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
      <duedate xsi:type="xsd:dateTime" xsi:nil="true"/>
      <environment xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
      <fixVersions soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteVersion[1]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array">
        <fixVersions href="#id2"/>
      </fixVersions>
      <id xsi:type="xsd:string">10001</id>
      <key xsi:type="xsd:string">AAAA-2</key>
.
.
. 
{code}

A customer is reporting that their SOAP client by Tibco generates this error when using RemoteIssue:
{code}
caused by: org.xml.sax.SAXException: validation error: unexpected content "affectsVersions"; expected "id" ({com.tibco.xml.validation}COMPLEX_E_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT) at /getIssueResponse[1]/getIssueReturn[1]/affectsVersions[1]
{code}

Just to verify, simulating what a RemoteIssue response should look like in SOAPUI, it places ID at the top of the ordering.
fields.summary: RemoteIssue SOAP response sequence out of order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14966].
  {panel}

define a filter
give it a column order
give it a sort order
run the filter
observe that the permlink URL correctly contains the ordering fields, but does not list the columns in the filter

This means that if the permlink is sent to a user with a different default filter column set, the permlink will not give the same view of the data
fields.summary: permlink does not store the configured columns of a filter in the url
Add Jelly Tag to update existing Custom Fields
Make single level group by report available in word and excel formats
Investigate if table scans on the configuration context could cause performance issues
Allow to select which columns (issue fields) are shown in the version workload report and the time-tracking report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14898].
  {panel}

I used to think it was just me, but I've noticed a lot of people succumb to this UI issue.
When using the Link Issue screen, the type selector defaults to "blocks".  For some reason I often forget to change the link type to what I mean it to be.  I have no explanation for why I skip that step, but now that I know it's a common problem, I'd like to request a change.

There should be no link type selected by default.
If the form is submitted without specifying a link type, the user should be told they need to specify a link type.  (I'm guessing this happens already since the user could presumably deselect "blocks")

Cons:
* people who want "blocks" would have to click it.

Pros:
* dumbasses like me would no longer have to delete their blocks and recreate whatever they meant to create.
fields.summary: The Link Issues UI leads to spurious "blocks" links
More options for default assignee
Do not render a hyperlink for a change history item for linking issues when the user does not have permissions to see the linked issue
Force lowercase via javascript in the user add page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14886].
  {panel}

At the moment JIRA does not (natively) allow connections to email servers using TLS (Such as gmail)

It appears that this functionality is available if configured using the JNDI service. So this report is just a feature request from an interested, reviewing user.

[LOG: "
An error has occurred with sending the test email:
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPSendFailedException: 530 5.7.0 Must issue a STARTTLS command first. 30sm14326411wff.11
"]
fields.summary: Support for TLS Connections within JIRAs own Mail Handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14883].
  {panel}

We have two types of JIRA users:
- Developers
- Users
Developers like the full-featured HTML JIRA emails, which include full interaction with the system.

Users are scared by them, and want less, but not format-less, emails.

Unfortunately, if we change the templates in webapp/WEB-INF/classes/templates/**/*.vm, that's a global thing. It would be much better from our perspective if we could define multiple templates (like "text", "full_html", and "minimal_html") and assign that to users and/or projects, rather than just full-html or text.
fields.summary: Multiple email templates, chosen on per-user level
Export single issue to Excel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14866].
  {panel}

We are a small company , and we are using Google for mail , calender etc ...
For now we are using open ldap to authenticate users for our Jira
But we would like to have a sort of SSO , using google users and password
It will be great to be able to configure Jira , to check the users password against Goolge

Even some instructions , how you did the ldap integration , would be fine
fields.summary: Implement login using google Authentication

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14860].
  {panel}

We are wanting to use groups to help collect different types of ISSUE types together. An Example of this would be:
(Group) Product Backlog contains issues (Requirement, Feature, Improvement)
(group) Sprint Backlog contains issues (Bug, Task, Test Case)

This could then be used to better generate reports and filters for different projects.

This would be very useful for burn down reports.
fields.summary: Grouping Issue Types together

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14857].
  {panel}

It would be valuable to allow more than one Issue Security Level. This would reduce the need for multiple levels to match the different combinations of Roles.  

For example, my company would like to create a Infrastructure Upgrades project.  This project will involve many outside consultants and internal staff.  I can use roles for permissions, and I can create the following issue security levels based on the roles we have - a sampling could be
         Omniware Internal
         Sales
         Network Admin
         External Gui
         External Web Services
         External Developers

This allows me to create issues for Sales people only that NetworkAdmins can not view.

If I want to assign an issue that both the Sales and Network Admin roles can see (e.g. a task relating to a product install at a client site), I would then need to create another security level for Sales_and_Network.  

So, if I have 5 levels representing 5 types of 'employees/security levels', I need to create 5 factorial (120!) levels to allow for all the different combinations.  

Instead, I would prefer to simply select multiple security levels for an issue, i.e. "Allow the Sales and Network Admin levels to view this issue"
fields.summary: Allow multiple Issue Security levels to be selected
Create a "test POP Account" button so an admin can verify that JIRA can read the POP/IMAP email account
Wiki format: allow the target of a link to open in a separate tab / window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14836].
  {panel}

When internal JIRA user management is used, JIRA does not allow users to be deleted if they have reported issues or have issues assigned to them.

Due to this, some sub-systems in JIRA expect that if a user is an assignee or a reporter of an issue, then the user must exist.

This is much harder to enforce when external user management is used. For example, Crowd.

Therefore, JIRA needs to be changed to relax this constraint.

*Issues:*
* Inconsistent Stats - In Browse project, issues under the unassigned bucket may show wrong results.  This is due to the null value being mapped to the non-existent user instead of unassigned.
* Editing an issue where it is assigned to non-existent user will blow every time the issue is edited.
fields.summary: Ensure JIRA behaves correctly when a user who has assigned or reported issues has been deleted

fields.description:
This issue has originated from https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-22123

While we love Jira, some UI usability issues become a little problematic. I wanted to hear your opinion on this: 
1. Open vs Non-open issues. It's very hard to see in the issue lists and issue page if the issue is open or not. The information is buried within the page and not very distinct. 
It's somewhat hard in both issue navigator and issue page. When one has to review issues quickly, just the status column doesn't always provide enough distinction.

2. Users often don't notice the comments at the bottom of the page, b/c issue w/o comments doesn't differ enough from the issue with comments.

I attached two screenshots: first one w/o any comments and the second one with one comment. I noticed over and over that people often don't notice that the comment is present in the second case, b/c they're used to some text in the comments section by default.
fields.summary: UI useability request for resolved/closed issues and comments
Notification for when issues are voted on
Sub-tasks quick creation for should inherit the components of the parent issue for new sub-tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14793].
  {panel}

I'm a user, not a developer of the Second Life Public JIRA. I created an issue there asking for a larger Environment Field when filing new issues, because the default two lines is far too little. As an indication, the typical Environment people are asked to enter looks something like this:

{quote}
Second Life 1.20.0 (84432) Apr 8 2008 21:02:50 (Second Life Release Candidate)

You are at 258036.4, 255465.9, 40.3 in Montara located at sim1172.agni.lindenlab.com (8.4.130.68:12035)
Second Life Server 1.18.6.75511

CPU: Dual i386 (Unknown) (2000 MHz)
Memory: 2048 MB
OS Version: Darwin 8.11.1 Darwin Kernel Version 8.11.1: Wed Oct 10 18:23:28 PDT 2007; root:xnu-792.25.20~1/RELEASE_I386 i386
Graphics Card Vendor: ATI Technologies Inc.
Graphics Card: ATI Radeon X1600 OpenGL Engine
OpenGL Version: 2.0 ATI-1.4.58
LLMozLib Version: [LLMediaImplLLMozLib] - 2.01.14353 (Mozilla GRE version 1.8.1.13_0000000000)
Packets Lost: 32/40071 (0.1%)
{quote}

It's a pain pasting that in such a small field, especially when you have to change some values or check it's pasted correctly (and not an 'old' copy still present in the clipboard).

However, my issue there was closed as it was not something Linden Lab could change, the size apparently is hardcoded in the JIRA software. It struck such a simple thing is not present. Therefor here my humble request, please make it customizable. Maybe now Linden Lab is the only one that could actually use a larger Environment field, but I'm sure more will follow. Then in the end, everyone will benefit.
Thank you. :)
fields.summary: Environment Field should be customizable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14792].
  {panel}

Please allow facility to be able add a progress flood bar to the road map but for each version.
So the current one shows percentage of development complete, another should show percentage of system testing complete and the last to show the percentage of UAT complete. Most of these status (e.g. In System Test) are ones we have created for this project.
Please advise if possible and point to documentation or how to do. Or is not is it possible to add this feature in a near release?
Thanks Russ
fields.summary: Break down issues on road map by status and show progress for each
Should detect and suggest solution when startup fails due to spaces in path
Misleading error message on custom user key validation
Group Multi Picker Only allows for Single Pick on Filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14747].
  {panel}

A search I would find handy is to be able to pull up all issues that are linked to another as a 'blocker'
(and in a seperate search, those that are 'blocked')

so we can see what issues are stopping others progressing

apologies if this is already possible, but I can't see it in the version of 3.11 enterprise I'm using (was set up before I started work here, and I have no admin rights :(   )
fields.summary: Ability to search for issues with blockers linked to them
Add workflow post function for cloning an issue
Issue Type Schemes Available to Project Administrators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14712].
  {panel}

Hello,

This is related to the support issue raised here:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-21188

One of our customers created an issue with summary "2.1.0RCテスト" (without quotation mark) in their JIRA.
They found they cannot find the issue by posting search query word "RCテスト" although they can by using "0RCテスト", 
" 2.1", "テスト" (all without quotation marks). They tried this with various languages for indexing but results were same.

We request an improvement to the searching capability of JIRA.

regards,

Neeraj
fields.summary: Cannot search JIRA issue summaries containing mixed English and Japanese characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14696].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

Let me share some pain :)

While scheduled backups go to JIRA backup directory specified in JIRA settings, all backup operations lauched by hand store backups in a different place (e.g. c:\windows\system32 - I assume it's the current dir of the JIRA service. See attached screenshot). To place a backup in other dir, admin always has to enter the destination path by hand; if there are some sequential changes pending assuming a series of backups, this may drive one nuts (especially if there's a typo and the backup file is lost somewhere in the filesystem). 

I'd say a preferable way would be to store backups always in the same dir - this will reduce the amount of typing to backup filename (i.e. if only filename is entered, the file goes to JIRA Backup Dir). Current implementation is so inconvenient that I prefer to RDC to the JIRA host, open JIRA in browser there, browse filesystem for the backup path and then copy/paste it into the backup UI field.

IMHO this thing may save lots of nerve. Thanks for your time.

Thanks,
~Nick
fields.summary: Default manual backup path should be set to JIRA Backup Directory
Key for additional/custom user property accepts only ASCII characters
Implement component centric "Component Workload Report"
No way to set the preference email format for the notification that send to the "Single Email Address"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14667].
  {panel}

I am re-creating my issue because my last one (JRA-14568) I think was erroneously closed by Atlassian as a duplicate and I don't see any way for me to re-open the previous one.

I would like it if we had an option in our profiles to specify that I automatically want to Watch any issue that I vote for, edit, report, or post a comment on.

I don't believe this is a duplicate.  The other issue (JRA-5976) seems to be talking about an option to impose a policy that automatically enforces Watching on various kinds of participants.

What I'm asking for is the kind of thing that any average wiki user (go check out Wikipedia) can do in their own profile, and this is to decide for THEMSELVES what level of "automatic spam" they want from the system.  They get to check-off, on their OWN profile whether or not they want to auto-watch items they have voted for, edited, reported, or posted a comment on.
fields.summary: Add watch this issue checkbox to issue operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14651].
  {panel}

On the Look & Feel page, we allow users to specify a URL for the JIRA logo (displayed in the header). This can be absolute (http://...) or relative to the JIRA webapp root.

The problem is:
 - Many admins do not have access to upload images to the JIRA webapp, and anyway any image there will be lost on the next JIRA upgrade, unless explicitly copied.
 - An absolute http:// URL to an image will result in an IE "This page contains both secure and nonsecure items" warning when JIRA is used over https.

So if you're running over https and don't have a public https URL for your image, you're out of luck.

JIRA needs a mechanism whereby customers can upload their logo image, and have it served within the JIRA URL space.
fields.summary: Allow admin to upload JIRA logo
Investigate effort required to support SQL Server 2008

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14621].
  {panel}

USE CASE
1. u have a bunch of issues to organize and u want to do that via bulk changes
2. u make a selection of - lets say all open issues - resulting in a few hundred items
3. some will be assigned to version 1.1 and others to 1.2 and then again there are some which are to be closed/refused

NOW
u have go through the list of all issues thrice, one for each bulk operation for the version
this is very counter productive as when u go through the list, u often have to look @ the issue and then decide
when u are done with version 1.1 u probably have forgotten those issues that need to go into version 1.2 and hence have to rescan that list again

WHEN u can do diff. bulk changes at the same time then u can open the same list N times and select there for each bulk operation the issues.

WORAROUND
currently i have to print out the list, make notes on paper as to what bulk change i need to do on a set of issues


NICER ALTERNATIVE SOLUTION
it would be even nicer to add a text field column to the bulk change view (named "bulk change tags" )instead of the check boxes. in this TB  u can enter a space delimited list of tags which then define the set of issues for a specific bulk operation. for the example above: 
i enter either A, B, or R. where i have to remember that these tags stand for: A=V1.1, B=1.2, R- Refuse

to expand the use case above:
lets say i notice while scanning thru the tasks that i need to do for some of the task another bulk change, eg. set the component, then i could enter in that field: "A admin" where "admin" reminds me to set for these issues the Admin module while A still means that this issue goes to version 1.1

the process to iterate through the respective bulk change tags could be like so:
1. choose issues (has now the added text field instead of CBs)
2. choose bulk operation tag
this gives u the choice which of the issue sets u want to select for the first/next specific bulk operation
the next steps remain unchanged by this concept, except for the last
3. choose operation 
4. op. details
5. Confirmation 
this step changes only in that regard that after completion u are returned to the page of "choose issues".
this shows the initial view from step 1 but it has kept the state of the column "bulk change tags". the tag that got just completed has been removed though from all those issues.
eg. when i just made the bulk change for A then the tag A is remove from all the TBs.
however it could be an option on the confirmation page to either remove the tag for the just executed bulk op or leave it, as there are also cases that for the same set of issues u have to do >1 bulk ops.


PS: i set the priority to critical as this would greatly boost management efficiency of issues in jira
fields.summary: [Bulk change] be able to do >1 bulk change selections at the same time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14620].
  {panel}

STEPS
1. bulk change some issues and proceed to confirmation page
2. discover that u need to change smth.
3. go back to [operation details]
-> values are resetted to defaults

WANTED
i dont want reenter all that i have done before but only change/add what is wrong/missing

this is at least true for the Issue Type, but i believe that also happens for other fields, i dont just dont have time to test that all.
fields.summary: [Bulk change] keep state of [operation details] when going back from [confirmaion]
Notification on Issue Linked
Upgrade the javacvs library used in JIRA to stop erroneous error messages appearing in stdout
Add support for Sun Glassfish application server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14588].
  {panel}

However, 12241 is looking at a deeper issue, in that the JIRA tracking system is rather flat, and does not contain a lot of functionality for organizing the 'project level' within the system. As well, organization by product is an imporant idea.

This is what I need to do. Currently, I"m trying to use categories to do this, as well as the 'key' in issues, so I may have several categories representing our products:

PPM
EPM
SPM, etc.

The key will then correspond to that, so I can see issues by product:

PPM - 001

However, this is a major workaround.

There may be a few things to consider, such as:

1. Ability to have custom fields on the project itself that allows you not not only filter by issues, but also by project. As many have stated in the other three issues you listed, there may be multiple PROJECTS for a PRODUCT. At least providing a way to filter by attributes on a project could help with this, as you can say, for example, "show me all my projects for this product". You can't do that right now, except through maybe a category, but, again, you can't actually create a filter on that. It only shows up on the dashboard - not very helpful for reporting.

2. The other issue is that there are times when a project itself may need to be broken down into smaller 'sub-projects' that then will collect their own set of issues. This is getting more into actual project management, which Planview does.

My problem I'm having here is that internally we are trying to implement our own tool, and use it in conjunction with JIRA. One of the problems is that the level of detail we want to collect issue information is at a level lower than the project....in our terminology, a 'phase' level, or possibly even the 'task' level.

Project
Phase
Task

The ability to be able to bring more detail into the system would be very helpful. For instance, we could import into JIRA the work breakdown structure for a project down to the level in which we want to collect issue information, and be able to roll that all the way to the project.

In the example above, import down to the Task level. Issues would be attached to the Task.

3. Another problem I see that people may be having is the ability to relate multiple projects to a particular version. Again, this gets back to #1 above, in that projects need to be able to have attributes on their own, outside of issues. So, you can create a filter that show you:

"show me all my projects for Version 10.x".

You can't do that right now because projects don't have attributes, except for category, and you can't create views based on project, only on issue.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

The other thing I was talking about was to have custom fields on projects, with the ability to create filters on projects, NOT just issues. People want to see, by PROJECT, not by ISSUE, what is happening for a version. You can't do that right now, because you can't create a view on projects. You can only see, by version, project information for a single project at a time.

So, what that means is, in your filtering functionality, a user could not only create a filter to see issues, based on values within fields for those issues, but also create filters to see projects. I know this is a bigger change, but it looks to me like others are asking for it.

The other limiting thing I see, which others are also running into, is your 3 level 'hierarchy'. It really isn't a 'hierarchy' per se, and it doesn't take into account complex project structures.

Unfortunately, JIRA is using the term 'project', and requiring that issues come off of projects, instead of just having issues and sub issues, and using fields/attributes to categorize them. When you start using the word 'project', and requiring that issues become part of a project, you begin to move toward the idea of project management, and all the overhead that comes with that.

As a project management system, JIRA, personal opinion, is not ready for. As an issue tracking system it has very good functionality. I'm running into problems with being forced to tie issues to this 'project' level, when I personally think that the idea of a 'project' is not necessary in this system - even though there is rudimentary time reporting. You want to have this, then you need to support more levels than 3 in your 'project' hierarchy.
fields.summary: Implement Component and Version Schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14587].
  {panel}

Plugins and JIRA should have a mechanism that would allow to verify, if a given plugin is suitable for a particular JIRA release.

Based on the SAC cases, it seems to me that there is a significant number of users who experience issues with JIRA, when they install a plugin and the plugin is incompatible.

There are two main advantages of such a mechanism:
# More robust JIRA; currently in the best case scenario, if the incorrect plugin is installed some functionalities won't work. However, in the worst case scenario JIRA can't start up/crashes.
# The above point automatically result in a new SAC case.
fields.summary: JIRA should verify, if a given plugin is compatible/suitable for its release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14577].
  {panel}

This is a followup to [this support request|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-20629].

When adding a comment to an issue, the issue's "updated" timestamp is automatically changed to *now* :

{code:xml|title=example : creating an issue + comment|borderStyle=solid}
<jira:CreateIssue assignee="-1" created="2003-11-07 12:54:02.0" description="..." duplicateSummary="ignore"
issueKeyVar="keyvar" issueType="Bug" priority="Major" project-key="PYWP" reporter="nicdumz" summary="..." 
updated="2003-11-08 10:01:12.0" />

<jira:AddComment comment="..." commenter="nicdumz" created="2003-11-08 10:01:12.0" 
issue-key="${keyvar}" updated="2003-11-08 10:01:12.0" />
{code}

After that jelley, the "updated" timestamp of issue ${keyvar} will be set in 2008, and _not_ in 2003, as some might users could have expected. This behavior stops me from importing an old comment without having the issue getting (falsely) updated !!

I'd like to have some sort of _syncIssue_ boolean attribute added to AddComment : When true, the issue's _update_ timestamp would get synchronized with the value of the _updated_ attribute of AddComment. Its default value, false, would keep the current behavior, that is to say, set the issue's last updated timestamp to *now*.

Thanks,
Nicolas.
fields.summary: Allow to use jira:AddComment "updated" atttribute to set up the issue's "updated" timestamp
Versions drop down in Configure Release Notes should be "grouped"

fields.description: Probably will need to clean up the links above the table that lists attachments as the "Attach Another File" link is now redundant.
fields.summary: Include the "Add file" form directly below the Manage Attachments page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14543]. {panel} {panel:title=22nd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff} Hi all, Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible. We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage. That said, we'll be investigating improving our emails and notifications in the future, so please keep an eye out for these changes when we find an opportunity to prioritise this. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com]. I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions. Regards, Kerrod Williams Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com Product Manager, JIRA {panel}   If one replies to JIRA message from Outlook to JIRA configured with _NonQuotedCommentHandler_ and _CreateOrCommentHandler_ the "old" message is not striped out. The html source code for the reply message around the end of the reply and the original message looks like: {code}
Cell:966.456.452

From: James Bond (JIRA) [mailto:agent007@mi5.gov.uk]
... {code} Outlook doesn't indicate/separate the "old content" from the reply message in any way that would allow us to program JIRA to recognize and process the message. For e.g. the blue line which in this case is separating the content, can be used for other purposes too. So, we can't use it to trim the content base on it. !OutlookReply.jpg|thumbnail! For references this is a screenshot of the reply email sent from Outlook. Currently known work arounds that might work in some cases are: - Change config of each Outlook client as per https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Change-how-the-original-message-appears-in-replies-and-forwards-1207f4ea-f7cf-4cdf-9298-5982fa2e5e2f . - Stop using this client ;)
fields.summary: Better support for reply emails from Outlook by mailhandlers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14532].
  {panel}

Give the ability to have cross-project workloads (estimate, actual and remaining) consolidation.
Example:
Project SOL is a "Enterprise Solution" project, involving several applications.
Project APP1 is a first "Application" used in this "Enterprise Solution".
Project APP2 is a second "Application" used in this "Enterprise Solution".

APP1 and APP2 need their own projects to manage their own issues, components and releases.
SOL needs its own project to manage Solution Requirements and any other Solution-level issue.

When a requirement is created in SOL, we would like to be able to link involved software change in APP1 and APP2 (already works fine with issue links) and consolidate workloads at the Solution requirement level.

This feature now exists when the linked issue is a sub-task. Workload is actually consolidated at the main task level and included in the workload progress bars.

We would like to have the same behavious for cross-project issues.

Linked issues' sub-tasks workloads should be included in the total.

This could be done by adding a "consolidate workload" attribute (boolean) at the issue link level, and then use this attribute to determine which issues to sum when calculating the workloads consolidation.

Pay attention to avoid endless loop.
Pay attention to count an issue workload once only.
Jira is not an accounting tool, don't bother with duplicate counting when an issue is linked to several parent issues, just count it once per parent.

Possible improvement: bother with the "several parent issues" double counting and add a second attribute "consolidation percentage" at the issue link level.
fields.summary: Cross-project issues' workload consolidation
Locale compatibility of Excel export
Issuesummary should be enhanced to add the status information to emails
Enhancement of jira.issue.editable to deny the deletion of attachments if set to true
Ability to add a new sub-task tab panel as a plugin module

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14500].
  {panel}

Hello,

When you export the issues from JIRA's issue navigator, the default paper size is set in the Excel file as LETTER. Since the defacto standard in Japan is A4 paper size, please advise how we can change this setting either during the build or via user configuration.

regards,

Neeraj
fields.summary: Need to be able to set default paper size of Excel export to A4 for Japanese customers
